movie_title: Why everyone loves the underdog ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Could being the underdog help you succeed? Neil and Georgie discuss this and teach you some useful v

vocabulary.definition: the person who seems least likely to win in a competition or situation
vocabulary.example: Despite being the underdog, the team managed to win the championship.

vocabulary.definition: moved to a lower division or rank
vocabulary.example: After a series of losses, the team was relegated to the second division.

vocabulary.definition: belief in one's abilities or judgment
vocabulary.example: Her confidence in her skills helped her succeed in the competition.

vocabulary.definition: failing to perform at one's best due to psychological pressure or social expectation
vocabulary.example: The player choked during the final moments of the game, costing his team the victory.
The team underperformed in the tournament, finishing lower than predicted.

vocabulary.definition: not supporting any side in a conflict or competition
vocabulary.example: As a neutral fan, she enjoyed watching the game without bias towards either team.
